Literature.Title: Ultrashort Cationic Lipopeptides-Effect of N-Terminal Amino Acid and Fatty Acid Type on Antimicrobial Activity and Hemolysis
Literature.Author: Neubauer D, Jaskiewicz M, Bauer M, Golacki K, Kamysz W

Literature.Title: Ultra-short lipopeptides against gram-positive bacteria while alleviating antimicrobial resistance.
Literature.Author: Zhong C, Zhang F, Zhu N, Zhu Y, Yao J, Gou S, Xie J, Ni J

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:50% Hemolysis=36.91 µg/ml,Mouse erythrocytes:10% Hemolysis=64 µM
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Enterococcus faecium ATCC 700221(MIC=8µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 33591(MIC=2µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=64µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC BAA-1605(MIC=128µg/ml),Klebsiella aerogenes ATCC 13048(MIC=32µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=4µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 9027(MIC=8µg/ml),Candida albicans ATCC 10231(MIC=4µg/ml),Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 12228(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=8µM),Bacillus subtilis ATCC 23857(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus aureus 75(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus 113(MIC=2µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=16µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=16µM),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MIC=64µM)
